meanings.definition: A person who tells jokes or amusing stories.
meanings.sent1: The codders at the party had everyone laughing with their funny tales.
meanings.sent2: The stand-up comedian was known as the best codders in town.
meanings.sent3: The codders decided to have a joke-telling contest to see who could make the others laugh the most.
meanings.sent4: Her grandpa was a true codders, always ready with a witty remark to brighten everyone's day.
meanings.sent5: The codders' performance was so entertaining that the audience couldn't stop smiling.

meanings.definition: A group of people who engage in playful or mischievous behavior.
meanings.sent1: The codders in the park were playing pranks on each other and giggling.
meanings.sent2: The codders in the neighborhood were known for their mischievous antics.
meanings.sent3: The codders decided to have a water balloon fight to add some fun to their day.
meanings.sent4: The codders' laughter echoed through the halls as they plotted their next playful scheme.
meanings.sent5: The codders' mischief always kept things interesting in the small town.

meanings.definition: To engage in playful banter or teasing.
meanings.sent1: They would codders each other during lunch, trying to come up with the wittiest remarks.
meanings.sent2: Friends often codders as a way to show affection and bond with each other.
meanings.sent3: The siblings would codders back and forth, each trying to outdo the other with clever comebacks.
meanings.sent4: As they codders, their laughter filled the room, creating a light-hearted atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The classmates would codders playfully, making the school days more enjoyable.
